title: Time to move to Canada...
body: The Reg says <a href="http://www.theregister.co.uk/content/6/36709.html">file sharers are not guilty of copyright infringement</a> under Canadian law.  "I cannot see a real difference between a library that places a photocopy machine in a room full of copyrighted material and a computer user that places a personal copy on a shared directory linked to a P2P service," said the Canadian judge.  This is just another reason to move to Canada.  They have free health care, cuban cigars, their president isn't a <a href="http://www.whitehouse.gov/president/gwbbio.html">miserable failure</a>, US currency is worth more over there, they have the better side of Niagara Falls, they use the metric system, the list could go on and on.  Maybe when the fast ferry gets here I'll commute (not for $80/day though).
bodyArticleHtml:
2004-04-01

Time to move to Canada...

The Reg says
